run_cmd.description: Executes a shell command on the system for automation and running apps. Use 'sudo' only when necessary and explicitly mention when used.

shell.description: If true, executes the command through the shell, allowing features like pipes and environment variables.

capture_output.description: If true, captures the commandâ€™s output instead of printing it directly.

text.description: If true, decodes the output as a string instead of bytes.

check.description: If true, raises an error when the command fails.

toggle_camera.description: Toggles the system camera on or off based on the provided boolean value.

state.description: Set to true to enable the camera, false to disable it.

open_site.description: Opens a specified website in the system's default web browser. If the URL is a search query, ensure it follows the correct format. For YouTube searches, use 'https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=<query>', replacing spaces with '+'.

url.description: The full URL of the website to open. Example: 'https://example.com' or 'https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=phineas+and+ferb'.

new.description: Determines how the URL is opened: 0 = same window, 1 = new window, 2 = new tab.

autoraise.description: Whether to bring the browser window to the front (true) or not (false).
